children.subject:
According to Fall 2011 offering of CS 164 by Prof Hilfinger, the language is C++ (yey!!!) I found it here: https://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~cs164/fa11/

But 2011 is almost a decade ago, I wish someone has updated info.

history.content:
When I took the course in fa13, as well as in fa15 based on the website, the class was in C++. I don't know what languages are used when other professors teach, but the course content / focus also differs quite a bit based on professor (e.g. focusing on programming languages or on compilers).

If there's no info in the excel document, then you should ask the professor yourself, and then share the information.

Two quick questions about CS 164 (Programming Languages & Compilers) next semester:

  • It's offered by Professor Hilfinger. People say normally CS 164 is taught using Java, except Professor Hilfinger uses C. Is this true? I hate Java, and love C, and don't want to take this class if I have to write Java code.
  • Do we have any info about webcast possibility? There is no info in the excel document they posted.
history.subject: CS 164 language & webcast
